metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36158 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
mwifiex_cmd_802_11_ad_hoc_start indrivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/join.c in the Linux kernel through5.10.4 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a longSSID value, aka CID-5c455c5ab332.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-204.236
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1089.98
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1123.137
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1095.102~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1147-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1147.157
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1151-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1151.161
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-204.236').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1089.98').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.137').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.102~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1147.157').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1151.161').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
